Gadget Parts
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher EVO Archive (PS2): Property (Items/Equipment): Gadget Parts
By Trickster on Sunday, April 16, 2006 - 02:11 pm:

***Page Under Construction***

Gadget Parts are, unsurprisingly, used in creating new Gadgets at a Gadget Shop. You can use up to three different parts to create each gadget, one of each type, but you don't need to add a Prop.

The Geonyte Tanks determine which secondary attribute a Gadget will train, along with other undetermined Gadget attributes.

Geonyte Tank:

PartDescriptionCostSold at
Pow. Tank SA small tank for developing Pow.???
Pow. Tank MA medium tank for developing Pow. May increase skill level???
Pow. Tank LA large tank for developing Pow. May increase skill level maximum6000G
Int. Tank SA small tank for developing Int???
Int. Tank MA medium tank for developing Int. May increase skill level.???
Int. Tank LA large tank for developing Int. May increase skill level maximum.6000G
Def. Tank SA small tank for Def.???
Def. Tank MA medium tank for Def. May increase skill level???
Def. Tank LA large tank for Def. May increase skill level maximum.6000G
Lif. Tank SA small tank for increasing Lif.???
Lif. Tank MA medium tank for increasing Lif. May increase skill level???
Lif. Tank LA large tank for increasing Lif. May increase skill level maximum.6000G
Acc. Tank SA small tank for increasing Acc.???
Acc. Tank MA medium tank for increasing Acc. May increase skill level.???
Acc. Tank LA large tank for increasing Acc. May increase skill level maximum.6000G
Spd. Tank SA small tank for increasing Spd.???
Spd. Tank MA medium tank for increasing Spd.???
Spd. Tank LA large tank for increasing Spd. May increase skill level maximum.6000G
MightyTank SA small tank for Pow/Def.10000G
MightyTank MA medium tank for Pow/Def. May increase skill level.15000G
MightyTank LA large tank for Pow/Def. May increase skill level maximum.
Tech. Tank SA small tank for Int/Lif.10000G
Tech. Tank MA medium tank for Int/Lif. May increase skill level.15000G
Tech. Tank LA large tank for Int/Lif. May increase skill level maximum.
Mach Tank SA small tank for Spd/Acc.10000G
Mach Tank MA medium tank for Spd/Acc. May increase skill level. 15000G
Mach Tank LA large tank for Spd/Acc. May increase skill level maximum.
Champ Tank SA small tank for Pow/Acc/Def.20000G
Champ Tank MA medium tank for Pow/Acc/Def. May increase skill level.
Champ Tank LA large tank for Pow/Acc/Def. May increase skill level maximum.
GeniusTank SA small tank for Int/Lif/Spd.20000G
GeniusTank MA medium tank for Int/Lif/Spd. May increase skill level.
GeniusTank LA large tank for Int/Lif/SPd. May increase skill level maximum.


Effect Kits determine the actual type of trick that will be performed, along with the main attribute to train. The color of the kit name in the following table shows which color trick the gadget will perform, and thus the mini-game used to perform it during Showtime. The monster types listed are the main breeds that can use the finished Gadget for training and tricks.

Effect Kit:

Kit NameTrick NameAttribute RaisedMonster TypesCost
Juggling KitBall JuggleInt???1000G
Swing KitAerial SwingPow/Spd???5000G
Box KitBox MagicInt???3000G
Baku KitBig LiftPow???1000G
Balance KitStick RideSpd???1000G
Cannon KitCannon RelayLif/Pow???5000G
Drum KitDrum BeatDef???1000G
Wheel KitDouble WheelInt/Spd???5000G
Trampo. KitTrampolineAcc/Int???5000G
Knife KitKnife ThrowAcc???1000G

Sword KitSword JuggleAcc???3000G

Water KitWater BallLif???3000G
Bamboo KitBamboo DanceSpd/Lif???5000G
Pipe KitHalfpipeDef???3000G
Bell KitFlying BellDef???3000G
Barrel KitBarrel TossPow???3000G
Gyro KitGyro SpinPow???3000G


Props have an undetermined effect on the final gadget, other than to change the visual impact. They do not have to be included in a gadget when constructing.

Prop:

Prop NameDescriptionLevelRecipeCost
Strobe PartsA light effect prop. Flashes one color of light.1Ore + Spirit2000G
Strobe P. 2A light effect prop. Flashes many colors of light.2Ore + Spirit???
Beam PartsA light effect prop. Fires many beams of one color.1??????
Beam Parts 2A light effect prop. Fires many multi-colored beams.2Gem + Spirit???
Laser PartsA light effect prop. Many beams of light cross in midair.1Gem + Spirit2000G
Laser P. 2A light effect prop. Multi-colored beams cross in midair.2??????
Light PartsA light effect prop. A single colored light from below.1??????
Light P. 2A light effect prop. Multi-colored light from below.2??????
Shake PartsA light effect prop. A single colored light from above.1Feather + Spirit2000G
Ball PartsA light effect prop. Multi-colored light from above.2Feather + Spirit???
PhotoLightP.A light effect prop. Makes light pictures on the ground.1Orb + Spirit???
Flare PartsA light effect prop. A light sphere grows and goes up the sky.2Orb + Spirit???
Dyna PartsA fireworks prop. Sparks fly up from all directions.1Ore + Liquid???
Perm PartsA fireworks prop. Shoots up lines of sparks.2Ore + Liquid???

By Trickster on Sunday, April 16, 2006 - 02:26 pm:

As you might see, not only do these tables need to be filled out, but we still need to determine different effects of different part types. I suspect for instance that the Props might have an effect on audience satisfaction, but that's just a total stab in the dark based on the fact that if it looks better, it would be more satisfying visually and as a spectacle. Input welcome!

By Trickster on Sunday, April 16, 2006 - 07:12 pm:

Oh yes, and what are thoughts on how to display which monsters can use which gadget types? Should there be a field added to this page, or should the gadget types they can use be added to monster pages, or should there be a separate page for finished gadgets that contains it, or what?

By RPGDesigner on Sunday, April 16, 2006 - 07:18 pm:

Hmm... personally, I think the cleanest way to display it would be to have a page which lists the gadgets and their properties in one table, and what monster breeds can use which gadgets in another.

By Kit_Wanderer on Monday, April 17, 2006 - 09:39 pm:

Yeah, the types of breeds that can use specific gadgets would be very helpful. I've wasted a lot of time trying to breed monsters that can fit my training gadgets >_<.

By Minion9000 on Wednesday, April 19, 2006 - 04:09 pm:

Tonight i'll try and get you the costs and stats of the tanks but theres 6, 1 stat tanks 3, 2 stat tanks and 2, 3 stat tanks and each one of them has a S, M, and L

Off the top of my head thou

Champ tank = Pow, Acc, and Def
Genius tank = Spd, Int, and Life
Levels are same for both
Lv1 = Increase in stats, cost 20000g
Lv2 = May increase more in stats, cost 25000g
Lv3 = Max. increase in stats, cost (can not buy)

I think the lvl 2's meaning maybe a increase in bonding, because if you stick a new monster or a monster not at a certain point on that trick, even if it has a lvl 2 or 3 tank it will still do a lvl 1 trick till it gets better.

By Minion9000 on Thursday, April 20, 2006 - 01:04 am:

Tanks
Mighty Tank : A medium tank for Pow/Def.
Tech Tank : A medium tank for Int/Lif.
Mach Tank : A medium tank for Spd/Acc.

lvl 1 costs 10000g
lvl 2 May increase skill level. costs 15000g
lvl 3 May increase skill level maximum. costs (Can't buy in stores)

costs for small 1 stat skill tanks are 1200g
costs for medium 1 stat skill tanks are 3600g

Kits in order of missing.
Swing Kit : An advanced kit. Makes Aerial Swing. Improves Pow/Spd.

Cannon Kit : An advanced kit. Makes Cannon Relay. Improves Lif/Pow

Wheel Kit : An advanced kit. Makes Double Wheel. Improves Int/Spd.

Trampo. Kit : An advanced kit. Makes Trampoline. Improves Acc/Int.

Bamboo Kit : An advanced kit. Makes Bamboo Dance. Improves Spd/Lif.

Props
20th down Pulp Parts : A snow effect prop. Colored paper falls from the sky.

By Minion9000 on Thursday, April 20, 2006 - 08:58 am:

heres the wording for Champ and Genius
and they all fall on the chart in order of
Mighty,Tech,Mach,Champ,Genius in S,M,L

Champ: A (small medium or large) tank for Pow/Acc/Def (add the may increase skill or skill max for med and large)

Genius: A (small medium or large) tank for Int/Lif/Spd. (add the may increase skill or skill max for med and large)

By RPGDesigner on Thursday, April 20, 2006 - 06:50 pm:

Here's a list of gadgets Hornie can use, slashed for copy-and-paste convenience:

Swing Kit/Magic Box/Balance Kit/Cannon Kit/Drum Kit/Trampo Kit/Knife Kit/Plate Kit/Prop Kit/Gyro Kit

It seems like all Suezos have access to the same gadgets.

By kilak on Friday, April 21, 2006 - 11:58 am:

here are more props
beam p.2: a light effect prop. fires many multi-colored beams
laser p. 2: a light effect prop multi-colored beams cross midair
light p. 2: a light effect prop. a single colored light from above
star parts: a fireworks prop. shoots up sparks in a star shape
globe parts: a fireworks prop. a giant ball of fire goes into the sky
ice parts: a smoke effect prop. covers the ground with strange smoke.
smoke parts: a smoke effect prop. creates patterns in colorful smoke
pulp parts: a snow effect prop. colored paper falls from the sky
sound parts: a snow effect prop. music notes fall from the sky
whisp parts: a floating prop. firefly-like lights dance in the air
tornado p.: a floating prop. musical notes spiral up into the air
